item.title: Graph Algorithms: Introduction
item.description:
Graphs and Network Modeling

Using the graph approach to analysis, you consider that the world is connected and, therefore, the entities are often not independent. Information about network leaders - or key nodes - can help find the most efficient way to spread information. Finding the most critical nodes can help disrupt or upgrade the resilience of the network.

  1. What is a graph?
    • used more in mathematical terminology and refers to a general language for describing and analysing entities and their relations or interactions
  2. What is a network?
    • a real-world dataset containing entities and their relationships, such as a social network, a communication network, or a road network.

item.title: Effective_communication
item.description: How to get the intended message across as efficiently and as unambiguously as possible in the shortest amount of time - is a question many of us might have asked ourself at one point. I wish I knew the right answer. But, in the spirit of enquiry, I shall endeavour to find a half decent answer.

item.title: On Jealousy
item.description:
Where does Jealousy come from? What force makes someone want to covet what others have? One way to think about jealousy might be to associate it with a desire of some form, coupled with perhaps a feeling of inadequacy at not possessing that object or entity of desire.

Could there be a positive angle to jealousy though? It would be easy to make an argument that jealousy is a cancerous emotion which keeps gnawing away steadily where it resides. It certainly is distracting by nature. Having said that, is this emotion still desirable if it leads to some personal transformation or evolution of some kind? I am not sure. I suppose jealousy will form a new object of desire once it fills the gap of what it was yearning originally.

item.title: Streamlit webapp for browsing Kindle highlights
item.description:
I wanted to view the highlights and notes from the books I have read on my Kindle to be able to make some posts for this blog, but Amazon does not make it easy for some reason.

The My Clippings.txt file, where a reader’s notes, highlights and bookmarks are stored, is hard to read and annoying. Apparently an industry has sprung up to help Kindle users make sense of their own notes and clippings-for a fee ofcourse.

item.title: Music which does not distract
item.description: Some background sound is always preferable to avoid our minds from chattering away. Well that has been my experience. I do not understand why it happens. Spiritual teachers such as the Buddha have suggested that if we are able to keep our minds from thinking about anything for even a single minute, we are already enlightened. It seems such an easy thing to say but incredibly hard to put into action.

item.title: Tron:Ares review
item.description:
This movie is a feast for the senses.

The red color is star of the show, which is to be expected from the title’s allusion to the Greek god of warfare and bloodshed. The cinematography is brilliant; CGI hits the sweet spot and my god the soundtrack by Nine Inch Nails! Some have even gone as far as to suggest that the movie is essentially a video companion to their music.
